page.title: 09Strange Happenings.
page.content: We discovered that there are three stories of the supernatural in our locality. In Dingwood Park there is reputed to be an old grey lady who wanders about. At Brookend the Red Earl, who was reputed to have been a Bishop of Gloucester, wanders around one end of the house. There is a connection here with the Red Earl's Dyke on Raggedstone Hill. The curse of Raggedstone Hill is an ancient legend about a monk from Little Malvern Priory, who against his vows of chastity fell in love with a young girl. The prior ordered him to crawl to the top of the hill on his hands and knees. One day when he reached the top he did not pray, but cursed the hill and anyone on whom the shadow of the hill should fall. Among those who suffered are reputed to be Cardinal Wolsey and William Huskisson, M.P.
